bib.title: Cross sections for the 6Li(3He,p) reaction at energies below 2 MeV

free_txt: The Argonne Dynamitron accelerator
Converted from F0027 by VNIIEF (SD).
The Argonne Dynamitron accelerator
Energy scale calibrated using neutron threshold in
7Li(p,n) reaction (1.8806 MeV) and at 872.11 and
340.46 keV resonances in 19F(p,alpha)16O.
Thin films of 6LiF evaporated onto various backing
materials.
approved by A.J. Elwyn, 19 August 1999.
Two Si surface barrier detectors covered with
thin Al foils used to detect protons, while a third
detector at back angles acted as a monitor.
Uncertainty represents relative uncertainty
due to counting statistics.
Proton yields measured relative to ground state.
Thin films of 6LiF evaporated onto thick Ta disks.
Data received from A.J. Elwyn, 18 June 1999.

Normalized to 45 and 135 degree excitation functions.

0.free_text: For continuum protons including breakup of 7Li formed in 6Li(3He,aplha) reaction.

free_txt: Continuum yields determined by integrating the spectra
from just above the 16.63-MeV level up to the maximum
proton energy, subtracting the net contribution from
the ground and 2.94-MeV states, and adding the counts
based on reasonable extrapolation to zero energy
where the yield should be zero.

Calculated from angular distribution measured at
angles up to 90 degress, assuming isotropy.
Absolute uncertainty.
Error from graphic bars and digitizing.
Error bars on a few points represent the total
error.  Authors employed several checks on
measurements to verify that errors (including
systematic errors) were 10 to 20%.
Digitizing error
Data scanned from Fig 12 in IEEE Transactions,
same as Fig. 9 in main reference.
